intro: Aegiphila platyphylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in the spring and early summer. Aegiphila platyphylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
